result.title: Simulation Experiments and Impact Assessment Report First Version
result.description: Based on the simulation tools that will be developed, this section will document the experimental design to take place in order to assess the impact of U-TURN. The deliverable will also include the results from the simulation experiments and the impact assessment based on these results.

result.title: Project Website
result.description: This deliverable presents the project website, which will be the main projects means to communicate and disseminate the U-TURN activities and results to a wide, external, audience. result.title: Current Transport Practices & Needs First Version
result.description: This deliverable presents the state-of-the-art transport practices (including logistics resource sharing) in the urban context. In addition, it presents the results of an industry survey with participants EU transport stakeholders of the retail sector that collects their transport practices, obstacles and needs. The content of D1.1 inspires the U-TURN platform offered services specified in D1.3.

result.title: Mapping & rating of InnoCreate stakeholders from all EU countries
result.description: This deliverable will map and rate existing support services available to C&I SMEs and innovative ICT SMEs operating in the CI sector in all EU countries at regional, national and European levels, with a particular focus on supports relevant to the InnoCreate service offering i.e. C&I SME supports in finance, networks, market access & knowledge. It will take into account mapping activities completed as part of ECIA activities, by other projects and the cluster observatory. Further information will be collected through online questionnaires completed by stakeholders in T1.1 as part of the engagement process. Rating of the services will be carried out by a panel of SMEs in each country who will be asked to rate the usefulness of the services they have experienced.

result.title: Knowledge Resource Centre
result.description: The Knowledge Resource Centre will focus on stimulating the adoption and deployment of innovative ICT solutions by C&I SMEs through informing them about emerging ICT technologies and helping to connect SMEs with technology providers interested in deploying new technologies.

result.title: Online Networking Support Centre
result.description: Th Online Networking Support Centre will aim to stimulate networking to overcome market fragmentation in the creative sector. Content and resources will be delivered through, for example, the: CI SME Showcase Connection centre CI Networking Resource centre: details of relevant reports and documentation linked to networking in the creative industry sector will be provided e.g. ECIA report on Cross-Innovation News/Events (communicated via social media in particular social media): Details of relevant networking events organised by partners or through other relevant projects e.g. ECB Network Creative Trade Missions or exchanges, partner events , Creative Cup etc.

result.title: Validation results and recommendations
result.description: A report summarising the results of the validation activities and determining if user requirements have been met or not. This will include a table with the list of user requirements, application scenarios and system specifications in the rows, and one column per row showing if and to what degree did the prototype fulfil these requirements. A section containing recommendations for post-project modifications will be included.

result.title: System Architecture
result.description: This document is addressed to all project partners involved in the design, implementation, testing and deployment of the FurnIT-Saver architecture. The document is a primary input for the WP3 and WP4 since a general view of the whole architecture is given. This includes a description of the database and user interfaces based on both web and mobile applications.

result.title: Economic Comparative Assessment Report First Version
result.description: This deliverable presents the results of the economic assessment of the alternative collaborative scenarios in terms of their benefits and costs (service time savings, transport cost, labour cost, trucks utilization, CO2e emissions etc.). It also includes their net present value and the total return on investment. It concludes with the results of the sensitivity analysis that present the impact of the different values of benefits/ costs on the total return on investment per logistics sharing strategy. The specific deliverable will also include a report.

result.title: Use Case Model, Services and KPIs Definition First Version
result.description: This deliverable transforms the afore-captured users requirements to detailed specifications of the U-TURN services in the form of Use Cases. It also provides the alternative collaborative transport scenarios (To-Be freight transport processes). Finally, it defines the economic, environmental and social KPIs for the assessment of the logistics sharing scenarios proposed by U-TURN platform.
